article_title: Chapel Hill police seeking man who stole $5,000 bicycle
article_text:
You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters

Message: * A friend wanted you to see this item from WRAL.com: http://wral.com/13670036

— Chapel Hill police asked for the public's help Friday to locate a man wanted for taking a bicycle worth about $5,000 from a shop at University Mall.

Investigators said the man took the Orbea Ordu bicycle, which is black with red accents, from TrySports on April 26.

Anyone with information about the theft should call the Chapel Hill Police Department at 919-968-2883 or Crime Stoppers at 919-942-7515.

Crime Stoppers is offering a cash reward of up to $2,000 for information that leads to an arrest.
